modName: Open-air bath in cities - Yukemuri Skyrim
summary: This mod adds open-air baths to cities in Skyrim. Currently, Whiterun, Solitude, Markarth, Riften and Windhelm baths are available. Fully navmeshed with some idle markers for your followers to interact. All the baths can be used seamlessly. Supporting Frostfall by Chesko.
descriptionHtml:
[b][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#ff7700][size=5]Open-air bath in cities - Yukemuri Skyrim[/size][/color][/font][/b]
ver. 1.4   (Added another bath in Whiterun. Activate a switch near Heimskr's house to toggle it on. You must complete "Battle for Whiterun" quest first.)
ver. 1.3a (Now player can redress by activating a cloth basket again, requires SKSE 1.6 or later.
                The new script was written by an anonymous supporter. I am referring him as [color=#1e84cc]ID:Q1NGNjYj [/color]here. Thanks a bunch!)
ver. 1.3 (Every bath now has a cloth basket which can be activated by player to get undressed.)
ver. 1.2c (Added a bath toggle switch to Whiterun. The switch can be found on the wall of the main gate.)
ver. 1.2b (Now all the baths support[color=#ff0000] Frostfall[/color] by [color=#1e84cc]Chesko[/color] and you can warm up by bathing. No master file required.)
[img]http://skyrim.jpn.org/images/619/61993.jpg[/img]

[color=#cc4125][size=3]What does the mod do?[/size][/color]
This mod adds open-air baths to cities in Skyrim.
Currently, Whiterun, Solitude, Markarth, Riften and Windhelm baths are available.

[color=#ff7700][size=3]Key features[/size][/color]
[color=#ffff00]Follower friendly[/color]
 - fully navmeshed
 - furnished with interactive idle markers
 - auto NPC undress/redress (optional)
[color=#ffff00]Seamless use[/color]
[color=#ffff00]Performance friendly
Frostfall support[/color]

[color=#00ff00][size=3]Recommended mods[/size]
[/color]Frostfall by [color=#1e84cc]Chesko[/color]
ZF Primary Needs by [color=#1e84cc]Varakz[/color]

[img]http://skyrim.jpn.org/images/622/62208.jpg[/img]

[color=#cc4125][size=3]Where can I find the added contents?
[/size][/color]
[color=#00ff00][size=3]Whiterun 1/2[/size][/color]
The bath in Solitude is [color=#ff0000]initially disabled and needs to be enabled[/color] by activating a switch.
The switch can be found on the wall of the main gate.

[color=#9900ff]Compatibility
[/color]JK's Whiterun - [color=#ff0000]Major Conflict [/color][color=#00ff00](Compatible if toggled off)[/color]
Dawn of Skyrim - [color=#ffff00]Minor Conflict [/color][color=#00ff00](Compatible if toggled off)[/color]

[img]http://skyrim.jpn.org/images/625/62592.jpg[/img]
[img]http://skyrim.jpn.org/images/620/62057.jpg[/img]
[color=#00ff00][size=3]Whiterun 2/2[/size][/color]
The other bath is [color=#ff0000]initially disabled and needs to be enabled[/color] by activating a switch near Heimskr's house.
You must complete "Battle for Whiterun" quest first or the switch is caged and untouchable".

[color=#9900ff]Compatibility
[/color]JK's Whiterun - [color=#00ff00]Compatible[/color]
Dawn of Skyrim - [color=#00ff00]Compatible[/color]
[img]http://skyrim.jpn.org/images/628/62836.jpg[/img]
[img]http://skyrim.jpn.org/images/628/62837.jpg[/img]
[color=#00ff00][size=3]Solitude 1/1
[/size][/color]The bath in Solitude is [color=#ff0000]initially disabled and needs to be enabled[/color] by activating a switch.
You can find the switch where Roggvir's execution takes place, on the wall by the stone steps.

[color=#9900ff]Compatibility
[/color]JK's Solitude - [color=#ffff00]Minor Conflict [/color][color=#00ff00](Compatible if toggled off)[/color]
Dawn of Skyrim - [color=#00ff00]Compatible[/color]
[img]http://skyrim.jpn.org/images/621/62122.jpg[/img]
[img]http://skyrim.jpn.org/images/621/62120.jpg[/img]
[color=#00ff00][size=3]Riften 1/1[/size][/color]
Riften bath is right next to Honeyside. The bath is visible from out of the city as well.

[color=#9900ff]Compatibility[/color]
JK's Riften - [color=#00ff00]Very Minor Conflict[/color]
Dawn of Skyrim - [color=#00ff00]Very Minor Conflict[/color]

[img]http://skyrim.jpn.org/images/622/62276.jpg[/img]
[img]http://skyrim.jpn.org/images/621/62200.jpg[/img]
[color=#00ff00][size=3]Markarth 1/1[/size][/color]
Markarth bath is to the north east from Understone Keep. Go along the wall and you will find it.

[color=#9900ff]Compatibility
[/color]JK's Markarth - [color=#00ff00]Compatible[/color]
Dawn of Skyrim - [color=#00ff00]Compatible[/color]
[img]http://skyrim.jpn.org/images/622/62275.jpg[/img][img]http://skyrim.jpn.org/images/622/62274.jpg[/img]
[color=#00ff00][size=3]Windhelm 1/1
[/size][/color]Windhelm bath is [color=#ff0000]initially furnished, but not ready for bathing[/color]. You will need to activate a pressure control lever to crack open geysers
to flood the bath with gushing hot water. Please check the pics below for where to find it.

[color=#9900ff]Compatibility[/color]
JK's Windhelm - [color=#00ff00]Compatible[/color]
Dawn of Skyrim - [color=#00ff00]Compatible
[img]http://skyrim.jpn.org/images/623/62338.jpg[/img]
[img]http://skyrim.jpn.org/images/623/62339.jpg[/img]
[/color]
[color=#cc4125][size=3]Any requirement?[/size][/color]
SKSE 1.6 or later

[color=#cc4125][size=3]Future plan?[/size][/color]
Adding baths in minor cities and settlements, etc.
PC manual undress script.

[size=4][color=#00ff00]Credit & Special Thanks[/color]
[/size][color=#1e84cc]Subtanker[/color], [color=#1e84cc]Ac3s [/color]and[color=#1e84cc] jet4571 [/color]for great tutorial and info about auto undress/redress script
[color=#1e84cc]Chesko[/color] for Frostfall
SKSE player undress/redress script for [color=#1e84cc]ID:Q1NGNjYj[/color]
author: Fjard
